title: Garlic Rice Recipe
description: This fried garlic rice is quickly made in one skillet with ground pork and fresh and dried garlic for a flavorful Philippine dish ready in minutes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Rice Side Dish Recipes Garlic Rice 4.5 (92) 73 Reviews 6 Photos This fried garlic rice is a simple Philippine dish bursting with flavor and aroma. Submitted by JAYVEECHUN Updated on November 23, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 2 tablespoons ground pork 1 ½ tablespoons chopped garlic 4 cups cooked white rice 1 ½ teaspoons garlic salt ground black pepper to taste Directions Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground pork and garlic in hot oil until garlic is golden brown; do not allow garlic to burn, or it will taste bitter. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in cooked rice; season with garlic salt and black pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook and stir until heated through and well blended, about 3 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 156 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Garlic Rice 01 of 06 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 06 Photo by  Ed Seutter 12/19/2020 I didn’t use the ground pork either. But I did add broccoli florets. Tasted very good. Everyone enjoyed it. I was expecting a much stronger garlic taste, but it wasn’t bad. 03 of 06 Photo by  Vanessa Martens 06/24/2019 04 of 06 Photo by  Seeker 04/04/2013 Didn't put in the pork and paired with Cajun Shrimp. The two dishes were meant for each other. 05 of 06 Photo by  hamilton 04/13/2010 theese were vey good but could use a bit more garlic 06 of 06 Photo by  Lucille 07/07/2007 My toddler really loved the garlic rice. Thanks, it was very easy and quick. 1 You’ll Also Love Dirty Rice 124 Ratings Roasted Garlic without Foil 165 Ratings Lemon Lentil Rice 7 Ratings Crisp Pickled Green Beans 181 Ratings Corn and Rice Medley 47 Ratings Stir-Fried Kale and Broccoli Florets 97 Ratings Vegetable Feta Rice 49 Ratings Zesty Zucchini and Squash 141 Ratings Fried Zucchini 149 Ratings Okra and Tomatoes 115 Ratings Down-South Style Green Beans 93 Ratings Garlic Green Beans 1,265 Ratings Sesame Green Beans 681 Ratings Summer Vegetable Ratatouille 164 Ratings Chinese Peppered Green Beans 26 Ratings Grilled Lemon-Pepper Zucchini 52 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir in cooked rice; season with garlic salt and black pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Cook and stir until heated through and well blended, about 3 minutes.
